messages: c3a61a0dec3221c8308785ceb546a89d (11:44): that's me on FreeBSD. finally got some time to boot it :)
c3a61a0dec3221c8308785ceb546a89d (11:49): how can i install additional themes for qt-based applications?
c3a61a0dec3221c8308785ceb546a89d (11:49): and where can i find them
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (11:50): there aren't too many pure qt themes
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (11:50): there are several kde themes, but they require the kde libs and KApplication. also, they aren't qt4 yet
c3a61a0dec3221c8308785ceb546a89d (11:55): i am just using gnome and i want add some themes for qt-based applications if it's possible
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (11:56): you can choose among the few default ones using qtconfig

c3a61a0dec3221c8308785ceb546a89d (11:57): yes. the apllication i am using allows to choose a theme from a menu but i wonder if it is possible to use some non-default themes because i don't really like those which are built-in
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (11:58): there are only a few plain qt themes
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (11:58): those who build qt based themes make them for kde, not plain qt
c3a61a0dec3221c8308785ceb546a89d (11:59): ok, i'll try to get used to standard themes then
c3a61a0dec3221c8308785ceb546a89d (12:00): maybe some day i'll buy a new computer and install kde :)
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (12:00): plastique is quite nice
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (12:01): very similar to plastik on kde
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (12:01): kde themes do not affect plain qt apps in any way
c3a61a0dec3221c8308785ceb546a89d (12:02): ok. thanks for info
021b7bf3ff2076c746a1ed6f90658a06 (12:12): how can i read a text file from http into a string?
021b7bf3ff2076c746a1ed6f90658a06 (12:12): example.com/text.txt -> QString
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (12:17): http://doc.trolltech.com/4.1/qtnetwork.html
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (12:17): http://doc.trolltech.com/4.1/qhttp.html
431262065635f41887ce641e0a528d6a (12:17): aep: connect the QHttp object's requestFinished() signal to a method that does http->readAll()
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (12:17): aep: i will assume you at least glanced at the docs?
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (12:18): chakie, don't assume that! this is aep we're talking about :P
021b7bf3ff2076c746a1ed6f90658a06 (12:18): ah thats it, i have to wait for requestFinished
3c2508887f30dc8ddbd9025ce2637e84 (12:18): hello, i need help with setting a pixmap as a background for a root window...
021b7bf3ff2076c746a1ed6f90658a06 (12:18): thought whttp can only save html
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (12:18): abattoir: did you post your request on qtcentre?
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (12:19): nuge: notorious "i don't read no steenking docs!1!" person?
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (12:19): abattoir: i think that might be a good place to ask
3c2508887f30dc8ddbd9025ce2637e84 (12:20): nuge: ok, thanks, i thought someone here might know :)
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (12:20): but anyways.. what do you mean 'root window' ?
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (12:20): abattoir: ya i saw your question yesterday, but i don't know the answer
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (12:20): http://doc.trolltech.com/4.1/qdesktopwidget.html#screen
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (12:20): perhaps?
3c2508887f30dc8ddbd9025ce2637e84 (12:20): i need to do something like what KDM does(set a background image to a x default root window)
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (12:20): i think there is some other way to get to the root window too
3c2508887f30dc8ddbd9025ce2637e84 (12:21): chakie_work: i think i've seen it, i'll look at it once again
3c2508887f30dc8ddbd9025ce2637e84 (12:21): chakie_work: there is also QPaintDevice::x11AppRootWindow()
3c2508887f30dc8ddbd9025ce2637e84 (12:21): but is it this possibe withouth the initialization of QApplication?
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (12:22): why do you want to use qt to do this?
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (12:22): abattoir: perhaps it works too, i haven't tested
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (12:22): xsetroot...
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (12:22): exactly.. why use qt if you don't even want a qapplication
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (12:22): oh my, that was back in the day when we hacked olvwm's configs :)
3c2508887f30dc8ddbd9025ce2637e84 (12:23): well, i have to create a qt port of something that's done in gtk... the gtk version calls a similar function, so i thought i'd use a qt alternative :P
3c2508887f30dc8ddbd9025ce2637e84 (12:23): my only needs are to scale an image and display it as background for X
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (12:23): well it does more than just set the root window.. no?
021b7bf3ff2076c746a1ed6f90658a06 (12:24): requestFinished () is never emited
021b7bf3ff2076c746a1ed6f90658a06 (12:24): not even  readyRead
021b7bf3ff2076c746a1ed6f90658a06 (12:25): http.setHost() 		http.get(/bla)

3c2508887f30dc8ddbd9025ce2637e84 (12:25): nuge: its basically an app which launches before KDM(it is a qt app), the app works well, i just need to set a background, but since the app can also be run inside a DE, i need to call the bit which sets the background separately
021b7bf3ff2076c746a1ed6f90658a06 (12:25): anything wrong with it?
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (12:26): aep: you connect the signals ok?
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (12:26): aep: no errors on stdout
021b7bf3ff2076c746a1ed6f90658a06 (12:26): connect(&http,SIGNAL(done()),this, SLOT(doit()));
021b7bf3ff2076c746a1ed6f90658a06 (12:26): .o0(i better create that object on stack)
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (12:27): have you looked at the sample apps?
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (12:27): doh

021b7bf3ff2076c746a1ed6f90658a06 (12:28): gonne do it

e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (12:29): http://doc.trolltech.com/4.1/network-http.html

021b7bf3ff2076c746a1ed6f90658a06 (12:30): create qhttp, set host, get
3c2508887f30dc8ddbd9025ce2637e84 (12:30): this is the code that i'm trying to convert to qt http://qtnode.net/pastebin/1267
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (12:30): don't create the objects on the stack, btw
3c2508887f30dc8ddbd9025ce2637e84 (12:30): (its python, btw)
3c2508887f30dc8ddbd9025ce2637e84 (12:31): (background is the path to the file)
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (12:31): ok
021b7bf3ff2076c746a1ed6f90658a06 (12:31): chakie_work: why not?
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (12:32): aep: it gets destroyed when it goes out of scope
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (12:32): new == on the heap
021b7bf3ff2076c746a1ed6f90658a06 (12:32): chakie_work: ok i mixed the declarations
021b7bf3ff2076c746a1ed6f90658a06 (12:32): i mean on the heap
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (12:32): ok
021b7bf3ff2076c746a1ed6f90658a06 (12:32): found the failure
021b7bf3ff2076c746a1ed6f90658a06 (12:32): connect didnt work, but didnt drop an error
021b7bf3ff2076c746a1ed6f90658a06 (12:32): connect(http,SIGNAL(requestFinished(int, bool)),this, SLOT(requestFinished(int ,bool)));
021b7bf3ff2076c746a1ed6f90658a06 (12:33): though i dont need the int and bool
6e39fc182cde48f018c30db6144125e4 (12:33): you don't, qt does.
6e39fc182cde48f018c30db6144125e4 (12:33): good morning, btw
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (12:35): aep: you only get errors on stdout when you compile a debug version
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (12:35): the release version strips all those QObject::connect() errorsa
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (12:35): -a
